title: How Japan’s multi-national team has knitted together to become a global tale
text:
Japan’s team hotel in Tokyo was used in the Bond film, ‘You Only Live Twice.’ The ‘Brave Blossoms’ are not settling for ‘twice.’ A win over Scotland on Sunday would propel them into the quarter-finals and add a third celebration to the victories over South Africa in 2015 and Ireland this time round.

The most multi-national team in this World Cup drew a peak domestic TV audience of 46.1 per cent for the 38-19 win over Samoa and have become a global tale. Tournament organisers claim 150,000 people thronged fanzones for the Samoa game while ITV reported a 2 million viewing figure for a match in which Japan became the first tier-two nation to win their first three World Cup pool games.

No wonder...
description: Japan’s team hotel in Tokyo was used in the Bond film, ‘You Only Live Twice.
